caption:
These cycles are both simple and complex all at the same time. And all of this is much easier said than done, I know. Changing attachment patterns is challenging, long-term, vulnerable work. But the reward is so worth it—relationships that are secure, fulfilling, and happier.

Caveat: this won’t resonate for everyone *and* we see this dynamic in couples therapy often. 

Sources: Dr. James Hawkins and Dr. Ryan Rana, based on EFT by Dr. Sue Johnson. EFT is rooted in attachment theory, which was developed by John Bowlby and Mary Ainsworth. It was first applied to adult relationships by Cindy Hazan and Phillip Shaver. 

Disclaimer: Content is for informational purposes and doesn’t constitute therapy. Posts are generalized and may not fit all individuals or situations. My posts don’t speak to situations of abuse, active addiction, or certain mental health conditions. Attachment theory is nuanced and dynamic and cannot be fully captured in a social media post.

#Secure #Relationships
